title: AIVA
html:
AIVA

From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
Jump to navigation Jump to search
For the Latvian given name, see Aiva.
Aiva
NationalityLuxembourgish
StyleClassical music
Websitewww.aiva.ai

AIVA (Artificial Intelligence Virtual Artist) is a electronic composer recognized by the SACEM.

Contents

  • 1 Description
  • 2 Discography
  • 3 Example of scores composed by AIVA
  • 4 See also
  • 5 References

Description[edit]

Created in February 2016, AIVA specializes in Classical and Symphonic music composition.[1][2] It became the world’s first virtual composer to be recognized by a music society (SACEM).[3][4] By reading a large collection of existing works of classical music (written by human composers such as Bach, Beethoven, Mozart) AIVA is capable of detecting regularities in music and on this base composing on its own.[5][6] The algorithm AIVA is based on deep learning and reinforcement learning architectures.[7]

AIVA was presented at TED[8] by Pierre Barreau

Discography[edit]

AIVA is a published composer;[9] its first studio album “Genesis” was released in November 2016.[10][11] Second album "Among the Stars" in 2018.

AIVA album "Genesis"

Avignon Symphonic Orchestra [ORAP] also performed Aiva's compositions[2] in April 2017.[12][13]

Example of scores composed by AIVA[edit]

This is the preview of the score Op. n°3 for piano solo "A little chamber music", composed by AIVA.
